means: 给…提供衣服，把衣服穿（在身上）

sentence.Network_cn: 他们给他们的孩子穿最时髦的服装。

sentence.Network_en: We clothe our thoughts in words.
She was on her own with two kids to feed and clothe.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (only recorded in the past participle geclāded), from clāth (see cloth)

entry.def: To clothe someone means to provide them with clothes to wear.

example.ex: She was on her own with two kids to feed and clothe.
example.tran: 她独自一个人要供两个孩子吃穿。

means.word_mean: 1. provide with clothes or put clothes on;

sentences.sentence: "Parents must feed and dress their child"

means.word_mean: 2. furnish with power or authority; of kings or emperors

auth_sentence.content: The hand that...often toil'd to clothe your little ones.

auth_sentence.content: To clothe my fiction in up-to-date diction, The contemporary jargon of Pride.

sentences.en: We clothe our thoughts in words.
The trees are clothed in green leaves.
